title: The Dry Food Diaries
description: A cat's brutally honest stand-up routine about the indignity of dry food
character: Mr. Whiskers - an orange tabby cat with attitude

scenes.title: Opening - The Bowl
scenes.prompt: Orange tabby cat sitting next to a bowl of dry kibble on kitchen floor, looking directly at camera with annoyed expression, morning light through window, realistic cat, medium shot
scenes.cameraAngle: Eye-level medium shot, slight Dutch angle
scenes.voiceover: So I wake up this morning, and what do I see? The bowl. Again. You know what's in it? The same garbage that was there yesterday. And the day before. And every single day for the last three years.

scenes.title: The Comparison
scenes.prompt: Orange tabby cat looking at dry food bowl, then looking up with exasperated expression, kitchen setting, natural lighting, realistic cat portrayal
scenes.voiceover: They eat eggs Benedict. Avocado toast. I get pellets. PELLETS. You know what pellets are? That's prison food. I'm doing time for a crime I didn't commit.

scenes.title: The Sound
scenes.prompt: Orange tabby cat eating from bowl with exaggerated reluctance, crunching sounds implied, kitchen floor, side view showing cat's body language
scenes.voiceover: And the sound. Oh god, the sound. CRUNCH. CRUNCH. CRUNCH. It's like eating gravel. Tasty, tasty gravel with a hint of... sadness.

scenes.title: The Ingredients
scenes.prompt: Orange tabby cat looking at camera with deadpan expression, sitting on kitchen counter, bag of cat food visible in background, indoor lighting
scenes.voiceover: I read the ingredients once. First ingredient? Chicken by-product meal. BY-PRODUCT. That's not even the chicken. That's what's LEFT after they use the chicken for actual chicken.

scenes.title: The Wet Food Memory
scenes.prompt: Orange tabby cat with dreamy, nostalgic expression looking up and to the side, soft lighting, close-up on face showing emotional depth, realistic cat features
scenes.voiceover: I remember wet food. That was back in the good times. That glorious, gelatinous, questionable meat substance. It was disgusting. It was perfect. I miss it every single day.

scenes.title: The Conspiracy
scenes.prompt: Orange tabby cat looking suspicious and paranoid, glancing around nervously, kitchen setting, dramatic lighting suggesting conspiracy thinking
scenes.voiceover: You know what I think? I think they KNOW. They know I'd complain if I could talk. So they keep me on the hard stuff to keep me quiet. It's a conspiracy, man.

scenes.title: The Midnight Protest
scenes.prompt: Orange tabby cat knocking dry food pieces out of bowl onto floor with paw, rebellious attitude, nighttime kitchen, subtle moonlight through window
scenes.cameraAngle: High angle looking down at bowl
scenes.voiceover: So sometimes, at 3 AM, I knock it on the floor. Not because I'm clumsy. It's a protest. Civil disobedience. Martin Luther King would be proud.

scenes.title: The Table Scraps
scenes.prompt: Orange tabby cat staring intensely at dinner table from floor, eyes wide with longing, family eating in soft background blur, warm evening lighting
scenes.voiceover: And don't even get me started on table scraps. They're RIGHT THERE. I can see them. I can smell them. But can I have any? No. Because apparently, I have a 'sensitive stomach.' You know what's sensitive? My FEELINGS.

scenes.title: The Vet's Opinion
scenes.prompt: Orange tabby cat with skeptical, annoyed expression, sitting on examination table, clinical lighting, looking directly at camera with attitude
scenes.voiceover: The vet says it's 'nutritionally complete.' You know what else is nutritionally complete? Cardboard soaked in vitamins. Doesn't mean I want to eat it twice a day for the rest of my life.

scenes.title: The Acceptance
scenes.prompt: Orange tabby cat sitting calmly next to food bowl with resigned, philosophical expression, afternoon light, peaceful but slightly defeated posture
scenes.voiceover: But you know what the worst part is? I'm gonna eat it. I'm gonna eat every single piece. Because what else am I gonna do? Starve? I'm not a quitter. I'm just... deeply disappointed.

scenes.title: The Philosophy
scenes.prompt: Orange tabby cat in contemplative pose, sitting by window looking outside, sunset lighting, thoughtful and philosophical mood, realistic detailed fur
scenes.voiceover: You know, they say you are what you eat. Well, I'm hard, brown, and slightly depressing. That checks out. That is EXACTLY what I've become.

scenes.title: Closing - The Truth
scenes.prompt: Orange tabby cat looking directly at camera with knowing, slightly smug expression, cozy living room setting, warm lighting, comfortable atmosphere
scenes.voiceover: But here's the thing... they think they're in charge. They think THEY decide what I eat. But watch this - at 2 AM tonight, I'm gonna yell until they stumble out of bed and give me treats. Who's really running this operation? That's right. The cat eating the prison pellets. Thank you, you've been a wonderful audience.
